name: Public Service Rules (PSR)
description: Comprehensive rules governing appointments, promotions, discipline, retirement, and administration in the Nigerian Federal Civil Service

subcategories.name: Appointments, Promotions & Transfers
subcategories.description: Questions on appointment authority, recruitment, probation, transfers, postings, acting appointments and promotion rules from PSR 2021 (Chapters 2 & 3).

questions.question: Who primarily holds the authority for appointments to offices in the Federal Civil Service?
questions.explanation: PSR 020101 states that appointments to offices in the Federal Civil Service are made on the authority of the Federal Civil Service Commission.

questions.question: Appointments to posts graded GL.07-GL.17 are made by which body?
questions.explanation: PSR 020102(i) specifies that the Federal Civil Service Commission shall make appointments to posts graded GL.07-GL.17.

questions.question: What is the standard probationary period for officers appointed on probation?
questions.explanation: PSR 020301 states that officers on probation will be required to serve for two years before being confirmed in the Service.

questions.question: An officer's incremental date, after appointment or promotion, is generally set to which date?
questions.explanation: PSR 020104 states that the incremental date of an Officer appointed or promoted shall be 1st January of every year, provided six months on grade with good performance.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a recognized category of appointment under PSR 020202?
questions.explanation: PSR 020202 lists categories such as trainees, probationary pensionable, non-pensionable contract, acting, and special appointments. 'Permanent appointment without formality' is not listed.

questions.question: Which committee is responsible for appointing Junior Staff (GL. 06 and below) in a Ministry/Extra-Ministerial Office?
questions.explanation: PSR 020103(a) states that the Junior Staff Committee of each Ministry/Extra-Ministerial Office shall handle the appointment of Junior Staff on GL. 06 and below.

questions.question: What is the condition for an officer to enjoy an increment on January 1st of every year?
options: Must have spent at least three months on the grade.
Must have spent at least six months on the grade with good performance.
Must have been promoted in the previous year.
Must be on GL.07 and above.
questions.explanation: PSR 020104 specifies that an officer must have spent at least six months on the Grade with good performance to enjoy the increment on January 1st.

questions.question: According to PSR, can an officer's date of birth recorded on appointment be changed during their career?
options: Yes, with approval from the Head of Service.
Yes, if there is a valid reason and supporting documents.
No, it shall not be changed, and contravention is serious misconduct.
Only if the officer is below GL.07.
questions.explanation: PSR 020107(II) explicitly states that the date of birth recorded on appointment shall not be changed throughout the career of the Officer, and any contravention shall be regarded as an act of serious misconduct.

questions.question: What percentage of all recruitments in the Service is reserved for persons with disability?
questions.explanation: PSR 020202(e)(ii) mandates that five percent (5%) of all recruitments in the Service shall be reserved for persons with disability.

questions.question: What is the age requirement for eligibility for appointment into the Federal Public Service?
options: Not less than 18 years and not more than 40 years.
Not less than 20 years and not more than 55 years.
Not less than 18 years and not more than 50 years.
Not less than 25 years and not more than 60 years.
questions.explanation: PSR 020206(a) states that an applicant must not be less than 18 years and not more than 50 years of age.

questions.question: Under what circumstances is prior specific approval from the Federal Civil Service Commission (or Board/Council for Parastatals) required for an appointment?
options: If the candidate has a university degree.
If the candidate has been convicted of a criminal offence or previously dismissed from Public Service.
If the candidate is over 40 years of age.
If the candidate is transferring from another Ministry.
questions.explanation: PSR 020207(a) requires prior specific approval if the candidate has been convicted of a criminal offence or previously dismissed/called upon to resign from Public Service.

questions.question: Which form must applicants for senior posts complete and submit to the Federal Civil Service Commission?
questions.explanation: PSR 020208(a) states that all applicants for senior posts shall complete Federal Civil Service Commission Application Form (FC.2).

questions.question: What form must a newly appointed officer complete immediately upon assuming duty to enter their personal particulars?
questions.explanation: PSR 020209 requires a newly appointed officer to enter personal particulars on Form Gen. 60 (Staff Records Form) immediately upon assuming duty.

questions.question: What is prohibited for a public officer regarding secret societies?
options: Being a member of any secret society.
Reporting their activities to the authorities.
questions.explanation: PSR 020211 explicitly states that no public officer shall be a member of any secret society.

questions.question: Under what condition can the standard two-year probationary period be reduced?
options: Automatic reduction after one year of good performance.
By deduction of previous satisfactory public service in cognate posts, to not less than six months.
If the officer passes all examinations within the first year.
questions.explanation: PSR 020301 allows the probationary period to be reduced to not less than six months by deduction of any previous satisfactory public service in cognate posts.
